dialogues.VADA:
[1]I was born jaundiced. Once I sat on a toilet seat at a Truck stop and caught hemorrhoids. And i've learned to live with this chicken Bone that's been lodged in my throat for the past three years, so I knew Dad would be devastated when he learned of my latest affliction. Dad, I don't wanna upset you, but my left breast is developing at a significantly faster rate than my right. It can only mean one thing.  Cancer.  I'm dying. 
[2]All right, who's in raise your hand. 
[3]I knew he wouldn't come. 
[4]Leave him alone! Come on, let's go. 
[5]Hey, you didn't pay me! 
[6]You're such a baby. 
[7]All right, follow me and don't say a word. You ready? You sure you wanna see it, or is someone gonna go yellow belly? 
[8]Okay. Lean forward. 
[9]I was afraid of this. 
[10]Well, sometimes when we get 'em, they're not completely dead, you know, like when they cut a chickens head off and it still runs around crazy. 
[11]I bet she's roaming around this house somewhere. There she is, in the rocking chair. 
[12]Hi Grammoo. 
[13]Seeya later. 
[14]Ahem. 
[15]Daddy guess what I beat Thomas J in monopoly yesterday. 
[16]Arthur!! 
[17]I beat Thomas J in monopoly yesterday. 
[18]Once you put the hotels on board walk and Park Place he puts a shoe in your way. 
[19]Cruella deville stole all the puppies, she was gonna make a fur out of 'em! 
[20]Dad? 
[21]Sure, come on in. So, have you had the unfortunate experience of recently losing a loved one? 
[22]
[23]Is that your camper? 
[24]That's really cool. 
[25]She's shy. 
[26]Daddy, how come that coffin's so small? 
[27]Is it for a child? 
[28]Then who's it for? 
[29]Oh wow, a real evil canieval. 
[30]I'm very sick. 
[31]Well, what is it? I can handle it. 
[32]That can't be, I have all the classic symptoms. 
[33]Yes. 
[34]I'll just have to get a second opinion. 
[35]The whole medical profession is a crack. 
[36]Hey look! 
[37]That's Mr. Bixler, let's go talk to him. 
[38]Hi Mr. Bixler! 
[39]It's okay. Mr. Bixler, I finished all the books for summer reading. 
[40]Yes, and now I'm reading War & Peace for fun. 
[41]Mr. Bixler, how come you're painting this old house? 
[42]This is one big house for one single person. 
[43]How are you gonna get the money for this old house if you're not working? 
[44]How much does it cost? 
[45]What do you get for that? 
[46]No. Well, guess i'll go home and finish off War & Peace. 
[47]No, I'm going home. 
[48]Dinner time?? You're like a dog! You just go home to eat. Don't pee on the hydrant!! 
[49]I think it's my prostate. 
[50]I am. 
[51]He is not my boyfriend! 
[52]Do you think I kissed that ugly old thing? 
[53]I'm not upset. I will never play with those girls. I only surround myself with people who I find intellectually stimulating. 
[54]He's allergic to everything. 
[55]It's a mood ring, it tells what mood I'm in. 
[56]It's only black when you're around 'cause you put me in a bad mood. 
[57]I don't think so. Shelly, how can I get thirty five dollars? 
[58]It's not a real school, it's a writing class, I wanna be a writer. 
[59]Shut your big fat mouth! 
[60]He won't give it to me. 
[61]Daddy, can I have thirty five dollars? 
[62]It's for school, for summer writing class. 
[63]Shelly thinks I'd be a good writer. 
[64]Dad? 
[65]Dad?? 
[66]The money? 
[67]Wanna play? 
[68]My ball, I lost my ball. 
[69]There's Shelly! 
[70]Can we look around in your camper? 
[71]Big Ringo fan. 
[72]I would. 
[73]Did you read ALL these books? 
[74]What are they about? 
[75]Are you married? 
[76]Daddy said it's bad when people get divorced. 
[77]Can I use your bathroom first? 
[78]You don't have to wait, daddy'll be mad if you're late. 
[79]I paid the money. 
[80]Uh huh, I wanna be a writer. 
[81]I wrote a poem too. 
[82]Loads of ice-cream by Vada Sultenfuss I like ice-cream a whole lot, It tastes good when days are hot, On a cone or in a dish, This would be my only wish, Vanilla, chocolate or rocky road, Even with pie a la mode. That's all I got so far. 
[83]Maybe they had a big breakfast. 
[84]Big deal, I can do that too. Thomas J, you got something! 
[85]Hurry! 
[86]Reel it in. He's only tiny, throw him back. 
[87]You're hurting him, don't kill him!! 
[88]Ouch! Darn hook! 
[89]I'm bleeding, did he get away? Go look. 
[90]Hey, we can become blood brothers. 
[91]You could pick that scab on your arm. 
[92]It'll bleed. 
[93]Uh huh. 
[94]Okay, rub them together. 
[95]Now we're blood brothers for life. 
[96]Are you going out somewhere? 
[97]So how come you're putting lipstick on? 
[98]I think lipstick looks fake, no-ones lips are that color. 
[99]No. 
[100]Shelly, do you think I'm pretty? 
[101]The boys at school don't think I am. 
[102]Do you like putting makeup on people? 
[103]Shelly, I would definitely hold off on that Hollywood thing. 
[104]No. 
[105]A girl can never wear enough eye shadow. 
[106]Oh, in the garage. Walk me over. 
[107]It's only a garage, come on. 
[108]Hey, one of my streamers is gone! It probably fell off in here. 
[109]That was Grammoo's. It's a phrenology chart, they used to study the bumps in your head to see if you had a good personality or not. Come here, i'll diagnose your head. 
[110]Come on, it's fun. 
[111]Hmmmm, interesting. 
[112]You have no personality. 
[113]Never mind. 
[114]Yes. 
[115]It's my mother. 
[116]No. Grammoo said she's in heaven. 
[117]What? 
[118]I think, everybody gets their own white horse, and all they do is ride and eat marshmallows all day, and everybody's best friends with everybody else, when you play sports, there's no teams, so nobody gets picked last. 
[119]It doesn't matter, 'cause they're not regular horses, they got wings, and it's no big deal if you fall, you just land in cloud. 
[120]Dad, why are you dressed up to go to bingo? 
[121]You never cared before. 
[122]Why? 
[123]Can I go too? 
[124]Here. 
[125]Sorry. 
[126]Let's go to the church, they're playing bingo tonight. 
[127]Pacifist! 
[128]Bed wetter! 
[129]We're not gonna bet, we're just gonna watch. 
[130]Duck! 
[131]Ssshhhhh, I don't want them to see me. 
[132]Go??? 
[133]
[134]We can go now. 
[135]I felt Justin's hangnail. 
[136]I don't think I'm allowed to. 
[137]Hi. 
[138]Sorry. 
[139]Dad, didn't you say you needed prunes REAL bad? 
[140]Are they ready yet? 
[141]When? 
[142]When?? 
[143]Hey Shelly, like seafood? 
[144]See food! 
[145]I like my name. 
[146]Are you here to take Shelly back? 
[147]He must like Shelly, I never saw him hit anyone in his life. 
[148]Does he love her? 
[149]Do you like her? 
[150]Why? 
[151]Really? 
[152]My Dad was funny? 
[153]Aaaaaaaaaahhhhh. 
[154]Carnnk yu sheeee ik?? 
[155]Can't you see it? 
[156]It's there. 
[157]Dr. Welty, are you sure those are yours? 
[158]As good as can be expected. 
[159]What? 
[160]
[161]What? 
[162]So? 
[163]Are you crazy, you'll get stung!! 
[164]What do you want it for anyway? 
[165]My mood ring! It fell off! I gotta find it! 
[166]I am running faster!! 
[167]Jump in the water!! 
[168]Do it! 
[169]Yes.. 
[170]I like the freak show. 
[171]Nephritis? It's a kidney disease, you don't get it from hot dogs. 
[172]I won, I won!!! 
[173]Where'd you get that ring? 
[174]Did you win it? 
[175]Oh my fish!!! 
[176]Not acknowledging Harry's comment You'll be okay little fish. 
[177]NO!, He's fine. Fish are very resilient animals you know. Don't worry, I won't get another fish. 
[178]I'll ride on the bumper cars with you! 
[179]
[180]Hi, can Thomas J come out? 
[181]Hi, wanna ride bikes? 
[182]Bye Mrs. Sennett. 
[183]I'm running away. 
[184]California, I'm going to Hollywood to live with the Brady Bunch. 
[185]No, you can't, they have enough kids, you'll have to live with the Partridge Family. 
[186]Get up!? 
[187]My Dad gave Shelly a ring. 
[188]You're such a retard, it was an engagement ring. 
[189]I don't like her. 
[190]He likes her better than me. 
[191]Then go home, baby. 
[192]Leave then, some friend you are. 
[193]No, I'm hiding out. 
[194]
[195]DADDY!! Daddy daddy!!!! Daddy!!??!?! 
[196]Daddy??!?!?! 
[197]Where's Daddy? 
[198]I'm hemorrhaging. 
[199]I don't want, I don't need your help.... 
[200]I'm eleven and a half. 
[201]My Mommy and Daddy did THAT? 
[202]I think it should be outlawed. 
[203]Oh, that's probably Thomas J, I don't wanna see him. It's not fair. Nothing happens to boys. 
[204]I dunno.. 
[205]
[206]Grammoo, I'm going to the bathroom, i'll be right back. 
[207]Why do you think people want to get married? 
[208]I'm gonna marry Mr. Bixler. 
[209]It is not. 
[210]Not true. 
[211]Have you ever kissed anyone? 
[212]Uh huh. 
[213]Maybe we should, just to see what's the big deal. 
[214]Here, practice on your arm like this. 
[215]Uh huh. Okay, enough practice. 
[216]Close your eyes. 
[217]Just do it. 
[218]Okay on the count of three. 
[219]One. 
[220]Two. 
[221]Two and a half. 
[222]Three. 
[223]Say something it's too quiet. 
[224]Just, hurry. 
[225]You better not tell anyone. 
[226]Well, let's spit on it. 
[227]Seeya tomorrow. 
[228]What? 
[229]For what? 
[230]I guess. 
[231]Hi. 
[232]Feeding my fish. 
[233]Yes. 
[234]I told him not to tease those bees. Did he get stung? 
[235]Maybe I should go over and yell at him. 
[236]Why not? 
[237]He's okay isn't he? 
[238]Dr. Welty!!!? Dr. Welty?? 
[239]I can't breathe, I'm suffocating. 
[240]It hurts, it hurts so bad, make it stop. 
[241]The bee stings! I can't breathe! 
[242]Wanna go tree climbing Thomas J? 
[243]His face hurts, and where is his glasses? He can't see without his glasses! Put his glasses on! Put on his glasses! He was gonna be an acrobat. 
[244]Get away, get away!! 
[245]Justin and Ronda say that I should tell people what I feel. 
[246]Mr. Bixler, I love you. 
[247]I love you like my Dad loves Shelly. I wanna live here. 
[248]No he wouldn't, I can't go home. 
[249]Who's that? 
[250]No.... 
[251]Get away from me! 
[252]I should have told Thomas J that he was my best friend. 
[253]Shelly, I stole some money from your cookie jar, to pay for the writing class. 
[254]I'll pay it back, besides, I don't think i'll ever go to class again. 
[255]I will I promise. 
[256]Goodnight. 
[257]Did I kill my mother? 
[258]The bees killed Thomas J, and I killed my mother. 
[259]I found this. 
[260]In the garage. 
[261]What was my mama like? 
[262]Really? 
[263]Do you miss her? 
[264]I think every time I see a climbing tree i'll think of Thomas J. 
[265]Daddy, it's not so bad to be like you. 
[266]Mrs. Sennett. 
[267]I will, I promise. 
[268]Mrs. Sennett. Thomas J will be all right, my mother will take care of him. 
[269]I can't stay, I just came to read my poem. 
[270]Weeping willow with your tears running down, Why do you always weep and frown, Is it because he left you one day, Is it because he could not stay, On your branches he would swing, Do you long for the happiness that they would bring, He found shelter in your shade, He thought his laughter would never fade, Weeping willow stop your tears, There is something to calm your fears, You think death as if you forever part, But I know he'll always be in your heart. 
[271]Hi Judy.
dialogues.SHELLY:
[1]It's still available I hope? 
[2]I'm a licensed cosmetologist, I worked for two years, at the "Dino Raphael" Salon, all my customers cried when I told them I was leaving. 
[3]I have a wonderful disposition, I put people right at ease. 
[4]They're dead? 
[5]Stiffs?? 
[6]The add just said "Makeup Artist" 
[7]Yes it is. 
[8]Hello. 
[9]Oh. 
[10]Excuse me, what about the job? 
[11]I need the job. 
[12]Ohh, oh sure it's no big deal, you see all my former clients will eventually die, and all your clients used to be alive, so they have something in common. 
[13]Okay Mr. Sultenfuss, you got a deal. 
[14]I promise i'll take good care of these people, they deserve it, they're dead, all they've got left is their looks. 
[15]Excuse me Harry, I finished Mr. Layton's hair. He kinda looked...... Harry, what's wrong with her?? 
[16]Who's winning? 
[17]You know Vada, you shouldn't let those girls upset you. 
[18]Want a piece of chocolate? 
[19]Thomas J? 
[20]To chocolate? 
[21]Chocolate? 
[22]Ooh, that's a pretty ring you're wearing. 
[23]Maybe black means you're happy? 
[24]I think you'd make a fine writer, did you ask your Dad? 
[25]Well you don't know that. Ask him. 
[26]Vada? VADA?? What happened?? 
[27]Come on sweetie. 
[28]Excuse me Harry? 
[29]Could you take a look at Mrs. Porter? 
[30]Yeah, 
[31]You don't like it? 
[32]I think she looks nice! Her lips are very thin so I used the gloss to give them a more sensual quality, and her eyes just needed a little definition, and her hair, I'm sorry, nobody wears this hairdo anymore in 1972. 
[33]I just wanted to get past this "old school Marm" image. 
[34]Harry? I was just wondering, if there is anything wrong with Vada. 
[35]Well the other night at dinner... 
[36]I don't think so, I think she's confused about death. 
[37]Harry, I really think she..... 
[38]Hi. 
[39]Sure. I'll give you the royal tour. Woah! Gosh! 
[40]Uh huh. 
[41]Liverpool? 
[42]Ohh, right. Would you like a soda? 
[43]Thomas? 
[44]Oh! You shouldn't be looking at that, it's a little too old for you. 
[45]Uh huh. 
[46]Mostly love, and romance. 
[47]They're just fun to read. Here, cheers. 
[48]No, I'm divorced. 
[49]Well, sometimes married people just find out they can't live with each other. 
[50]With bottle of soda in mouth Thomas pulls out a few bank notes of largish denomination 
[51]Well, I guess you found my secret hiding place. 
[52]Nothing in particular, just putting it away for a rainy day. 
[53]Bye. Well Miss Vada, what d'you say we head back? 
[54]Sure. 
[55]Okay. 
[56]Excuse me Harry, I'm sorry, I just wanna let you know that the flowers were delivered. And the room's all set up. 
[57]I shouldn't stick my nose in other people's business. It's just that I like Vada, very much. 
[58]I'm sure she will. 
[59]Hi. 
[60]Nothing, I was just wondering what you were doing. 
[61]Oh right, right, Bader Lorenzo Died June 22 1972 Devoted husband to Nicolette. Cherished father of Babritzio and Heidi, In lieu of flowers, please send donations to the holy names society. 
[62]No kidding? 
[63]Oh it's good, "In lieu of" I love that word lieu. 
[64]In lieu... "instead".... No contest. 
[65]You have to learn how to take a complement. Movies, movies, ahhhh, "Love Story" at the drive in, I cried my eyes out, did you see it? 
[66]I love going to movies, especially at the drive in. I don't think there's anything more romantic than going to the drive in. I'll let you get back to work. 
[67]Okay. 
[68]Hi Vada. 
[69]No. 
[70]A girl's always gotta look her best. 
[71]Have you ever tried any? 
[72]Come here, sit down. 
[73]Now, first we blot. 
[74]Take a look. I think it looks real nice on you. 
[75]Yes, Vada I think you're very pretty. You've got these great big sparkling eyes, the cutest little nose, an amazing mouth. 
[76]They'll come around. Close your eyes, I wanna bring out the gorgeous color in them. The first rule in applying eye makeup, is you can never wear enough blue eye shadow. 
[77]Uh huh, i've been trying to get out to Hollywood for years to do makeup for all the stars, I haven't gotten there yet. All right, open your eyes. 
[78]Does it make it easier to win? 
[79]Oh great! 
[80]Aarrggh. 
[81]I just had a terrible thought Harry. 
[82]I'm gonna be putting makeup on some of these people very soon. 
[83]Oh, I'm just not lucky Harry. 
[84]Kinda like men. 
[85]You can be in a room with 100 men, and not like any of them, or you can be in a room with just one man, and he's exactly the one you want. 
[86]I had a good time tonight. 
[87]Would you like to come in and see my house? Just for a minute. 
[88]Home sweet home. 
[89]I did it myself. I read a magazine article about how to maximize small spaces. 
[90]You can look in the bathroom if you want. People are always curious about that, like what happens when you flush. 
[91]Are you mad at me? 
[92]I don't know, tonight you just seemed a little cool, not opening car doors and... 
[93]What happened to her? 
[94]Did she ever see Vada? 
[95]Dance with me? 
[96]This is where we are. 
[97]In ages, I know, me neither. 
[98]See, you're not that out of touch. You're good. 
[99]What are you wearing? 
[100]Do you want to? 
[101]Kiss me. 
[102]Good. 
[103]Good at kissing, and dancing, I'm very optimistic. 
[104]It's only eight o'clock. 
[105]Goodnight. 
[106]Well, I guess it's official we had a date, maybe we can play bingo again sometime. 
[107]Goodnight. 
[108]Hey, I thought I recognized you two, hi Vada. 
[109]Yeah, me too, mind if I tag along? 
[110]It's for Shelly's famous potato salad. 
[111]You know this is gonna be my first 4th of July picnic in a long time. 
[112]How's it going chef? 
[113]Rub a dub dub, thanks for the grub, yay God. 
[114]Uh huh, why? 
[115]That's attractive. 
[116]Oh shit! Excuse me... 
[117]Danny, what are you doing here? 
[118]Hi Ralph. Oh Danny, how'd you find me here? 
[119]No! _I_ bought it, _I_ paid for it... 
[120]I've been living in it for over a year, the camper is mine. 
[121]Keep your voice down! 
[122]The boss is watching us... 
[123]God I guess i'll have to introduce you now. 
[124]This is Harry, Phil, Grammoo and Vada Sultenfuss... 
[125]This is Danny and Ralph, they own the Dino Raphael salon in Detroit. We used to be married. 
[126]Ex...ex, ex... 
[127]Honestly Harry, he got the mustang, I promise..... 
[128]Danny that's a real _bonehead_ thing to say! 
[129]Stop it! That hurts!! 
[130]Bye Ralph. 
[131]Well, you were pretty great! 
[132]Can we see it from the back yard? 
[133]Pointing upwards Look... 
[134]I would never marry anybody I didn't love. 
[135]So Vada, what's your favorite ride? 
[136]I don't think that that roller coaster agreed with your bad stomach. You know Vada you have to watch what you eat here, I remember one time I went to a carnival with my cousins David and Frank, and they both ate hot dogs, and the next day they came down with nephritis. 
[137]Well, I'm no doctor. All I know is, the next day they had really high fevers, and their faces got very fat. They baffled medical science, they were in a magazine. 
[138]They were!! "Popular Mechanics", no "Popular Science". I don't know, popular. 
[139]Oh look they're trying to hit that poor thing. 
[140]Perfect. 
[141]Oh great!! 
[142]Oh Vada, that's a gorgeous goldfish. 
[143]Vada we have something to tell you. Harry? 
[144]Vada? Would you like us to get you another goldfish? 
[145]Oh bumper cars, oh you can't go to a carnival and not ride the bumper cars. 
[146]Oh great Vada, come on... 
[147]Uhh, two. I got the blue one!! 
[148]Yes!! 
[149]I am gonna get you. 
[150]Vada, Vada, what's the matter? 
[151]Well he just left, what's wrong? 
[152]What do you mean you're hemorrhaging? 
[153]Vada, did this happen in the bathroom? 
[154]How old are you? 
[155]It's okay, come on upstairs, we have to have a little talk. 
[156]It's actually a very beautiful thing, and look there wouldn't have been a Vada. 
[157]Believe me, some day, you'll feel differently. 
[158]Knocks Vada? View shifts to inside Vada's bedroom, where she is curled up in a little ball on her bed Vada remains where she is, the doorbell rings 
[159]Hi. 
[160]Yes she is, but she's very upset, so she's not seeing anyone. 
[161]Well maybe she'll feel better in a couple of days. 
[162]Sure. 
[163]Bye. 
[164]Vada? I see you took your tray in, Maybe you should come down for the funeral, sometimes it helps. Vada? 
[165]She won't come out. It's been a whole day. You have to do something Harry. 
[166]Open your eyes, she's eleven years old! Her only friend in the world is dead. 
[167]Stop hiding Harry, you run Harry. When I first came here, the idea of working with dead people, didn't exactly thrill me, but when I saw a family lived here, I thought, "if I'm living without a family, at least I can work with one, and maybe once in a while i'll be invited in for supper." 
[168]I'm not asking you to stop feeling for those people. But life isn't just death Harry, don't ignore the living, especially your daughter. 
[169]It's dark, she can't be alone in the dark. 
[170]We, no, we've been looking since this morning, her teacher called, and he said that she went there first..... 
[171]But I.... 
[172]Vada. Are you okay? Oh God. 
[173]I'm sure he knew. 
[174]It's okay sweetheart. 
[175]I'll tell you what, you dedicate your first book to me, and we'll forget about the whole thing. 
[176]Okay, get in to bed. 
[177]Goodnight. 
[178]She's in.
dialogues.HARRY:
[1]O.K. Sweetie, hand me the mayonnaise out of the fridge. 
[2]Vada would you bring down my cigarettes? 
[3]Did I tell you, he was my woodshop teacher. 
[4]Yeah, I made a tie rack. 
[5]Vada, just put 'em on the stool. 
[6]Ya, that rack holds six ties. 
[7]Vada, we're trying to work here. 
[8]Hand me the canula. 
[9]
[10]I'm embalming my high school teacher, don't sing. All right Arthur, just a slide of the needle..... 
[11]One nice model C-501 bronze stainless eternal journey, yeah, you look like a champion. 
[12]How may I... Help you? 
[13]Oh yes. 
[14]I think it's still available. 
[15]Uhh, Miss devoto... 
[16]Uhh, Miss devoto, these people are already at ease. This is not a Beauty Parlor, it's a Funeral Parlor. 
[17]Yes they are. 
[18]Deceased. 
[19]Ahh, excuse me a second will you? Hi George, this is a twelve-fifty-eight, I didn't want the burnished handles. 
[20]Just put it back in the display room fellers. 
[21]They come in all sizes honey, just like shoes. 
[22]Of course not. 
[23]Short people, very short people. 
[24]Pardon? 
[25]Oh, You still want it? Even though uhh... 
[26]You'd be doing hair and makeup and answering the phone. 
[27]Great, you can start right away. Call me Harry. Now, umm, is this what you'd normally wear for work? Don't get me wrong, I like it, very much, but the.... 
[28]Oh, she's just pretending. Vada, get up here and eat your broccoli! 
[29]That's a lot of money for a little girl. 
[30]Any more soda left? 
[31]Last month you wanted to play the violin. Then you wanted to be a ventriloquist. 
[32]I love this guy! 
[33]What? 
[34]Ahh, maybe next summer. 
[35]Uh huh? 
[36]Yeah. Didn't I give you a picture of what she looked like? 
[37]This was the Reverend Porter's wife, you have her looking like a two dollar hooker. 
[38]She did. This photo was taken a month ago at the church food drive. 
[39]That wasn't an image. She WAS an old school Marm. Fix it. 
[40]What do you mean?? 
[41]Oh that, she just likes to play. 
[42]She was raised in a funeral home, she knows a thing or two about it. 
[43]She's a perfectly happy eleven year old girl, look, don't give me any advice about my daughter, okay? 
[44]Can not do without, Harry's wild about me. 
[45]Thanks, listen I wanna apologize for the other day downstairs, about Vada, I was a little harsh. 
[46]After my wife died, Grammoo moved in here to help take care of Vada. They were very close, but lately as her mind's been wandering more and more, Vada's been acting kinda crazy. I'm sure she'll snap out of it though. 
[47]Oh Hi, what can I do for you? 
[48]Oh, I'm just typing up a funeral notice, you know when someone dies people want it in the paper usually, it's a service we provide for the family. 
[49]I wrote that. 
[50]I prefer it to "instead", it has more dignity. 
[51]It's no big deal. 
[52]I haven't been to the movies in AGES. 
[53]I do enjoy playing bingo, if you'd like to join me for a game tomorrow night at church you're welcome to. 
[54]Nothing, I'm dressing. 
[55]
[56]I'm very nervous. 
[57]The last date I had was twenty years ago. 
[58]Oh come on. 
[59]Are you sure about all this? 
[60]Oh, I'm running late. Shelly'll be here any minute. 
[61]No, she's just driving over here, then we're taking my car. How do I look? 
[62]Goodnight Vada. 
[63]Ahh, I just wanna look nice.

dialogues.VADA'S THOUGHTS:
[1]He forgot about the time I wanted to be a magician, I was really great at making myself disappear. 
[2]My fears and secrets. I'm afraid I killed my mother. 
[3]Grammoo once had a hangnail on her big toe. It got infected and traveled to her vocal chords, it ruined her singing voice, I don't think Grammoo thought it was insignificant. 
[4]I used to like to play with my Ken and Barbie dolls, Ken was my favorite. Then one Christmas I got them a camper, and all they wanted to do was hang out in it by themselves. So I wasn't too upset when they took that wrong turn and went over a cliff. 
[5]My Uncle fought in the Korean war, he had a steel plate put in his head, Daddy said he didn't come back the same, one night, he picked up a radio station from Oklahoma in his teeth, it was really neat. 
[6]In social studies we learned some people stole the Limburg baby right out of his house, I think i'll sleep with my window OPEN tonight.

[8]It's my mother. 
[9]Now we're blood brothers for life.
